text:
13
CONCLUSIONS
Within the limitations of the investigation, the following conclusions
were reached:
I.
A* At no time, during any of the three surveys, were more than
1% of the sample listening to the radio between the hours of 7-10
p.m. This percentage did not vary appreciably from survey to survey.
The establishment of an AM broadcasting facility did not seem to
change the night time radio listening as established by the first
two surveys*
B. Surveys #1 and #2 indicated that of this 7$, approximately 10% were
listening to WOIJI. Survey #3, taken after the establishment of the
AM transmitter, showed that approximately 85$ were listening to
WOUB, This was a c onsiderable increase over the previous two
surveys. It can be assumed that the increase was due in part to the
ability of the listener to receive a more strongly transmitted
radio signal than "rom any of the other radio stations reaching this
area. Other elements that might have influenced this statistic were;
(1) the novelty of a new station being in the area, (2) acceptaoility
of the programming, (3) interest of a college community in the
broadcasting of a University radio station*
II*
A, Approximately 38$ of the sample of surveys #1 and #2 had listened
to WOUI at some time* This figure increased to 72$ for survey #3*
It is also assumed that the reasons stated in part B of conclusion
I would also apply in this case*
